Lack enough support: The claim that Boris Johnson said his party has "wiped out the national debt" lacks evidence or any concrete support.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Conservatives nearly doubled the debt from £950 billion to £1.8 trillion.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Boris Johnson made the statement, but there is no evidence to support this assumption.
Understate: The claim understates the actual debt figures by not mentioning the current debt of £1.8 trillion (81% of GDP) and the debt of just over £1 trillion (64% of GDP) in May 2010.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the achievement of "wiping out the national debt" by Boris Johnson's party, as there is no evidence to support this claim.
Exist alternative explanation: It is possible that Boris Johnson made the claim somewhere other than during his keynote conference speech, but there is no evidence to support this alternative explanation.
